title.rendered: KFC India addHope partners with Smile Foundation to provide nutritional support to underprivileged school going children

content.rendered:
KFC India addHope partners with Smile Foundation to provide nutritional support to underprivileged school going children

 

KFC is committed to serving the communities where it lives and works through Add Hope—a program created to help to end hunger through fundraising and active partnerships with organizations around the world. Through addHope, KFC India is committed to providing 20 million meals to underprivileged children by 2020 and for this KFC has joined hands with Smile Foundation for supporting a meal program for 2500 underprivileged children. Smile Foundation has provided support for approx. 600,000 meals and will further provide support of 400,000 meals to these underprivileged children from Odisha, Kolkata, Nagaland, Tripura, Tamilnadu, Vishakhapatnam, Gurgaon, Ghaziabad (UP) and Delhi

KFC is the world’s most popular chicken restaurant chain, specializing in famous Original Recipe fried chicken. It all started with one cook who created a finger lickin’ good recipe more than 75 years ago, a list of secret herbs and spices scratched out on the back of the door to his kitchen. That cook was Colonel Harland Sanders, of course, and today we still follow his formula for success, with real cooks breading and freshly preparing delicious chicken by hand in more than 20,000 restaurants in more than 125 countries. With the help of incredible franchise partners around the world, KFC has become one of the fastest growing retail brands, both in emerging and developed markets alike.

 

ClDonate now
